means: 遗物，纪念品，用以回忆的东西

sentence.Network_en: a memento of our trip to Italy
sentence.Network_cn: 我们意大利之旅的纪念品

sentence.Network_en: The photos will be a permanent memento of your wedding.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些照片会成为你婚礼的永久纪念.

sentence.Network_en: My friend gave me his picture as a memento before going away.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的朋友在离别前给我一张照片留作纪念品.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a prayer of commemoration): from Latin, literally remember!', imperative of meminisse

entry.def: A memento is an object which you keep because it reminds you of a person or a special occasion.

example.ex: More anglers are taking cameras when they go fishing to provide a memento of catches.
example.tran: 更多的垂钓者去钓鱼的时候带上了照相机，以便钓上鱼后留个纪念。

auth_sentence.content: Desperately feel-good club pop as a memento mori?
auth_sentence.res_content: Desperately feel-good club pop as a memento mori?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Desperately feel-good club pop as a memento mori?

auth_sentence.content: It's a keepsake for me, just a memento.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's a keepsake for me, just a memento.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a keepsake for me, just a memento.

auth_sentence.content: "It's a treasured memento," says Mr. Petrocik.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "It's a treasured memento," says Mr. Petrocik.

means.word_mean: 纪念品,令人回忆的东西

sentences.en: They gave him a watch as a memento of his time with the company.
sentences.cn: 他们送了他一块手表作为为公司服务的纪念。

sentences.en: The director will be presented with a memento for his long years of service.
sentences.cn: 主管因为公司效力多年将获赠予纪念品。

sentences.en: The photos will be a permanent memento of your wedding.
sentences.cn: 这些照片会成为你婚礼的永久纪念。
